regards to other systems.

Okay.
And,

And then you go action things in other systems.
I was, I'm curious to hear about your opinion of kind of that bifurcation of ideology.
I.
Think that the best person to answer that would be Eugene because he's more, you know, hands on the everyday resolution and overseeing the team that does that, you know,
Last year, when we were trying to use the voho, AI agent, we had a lot of trouble because they use gpt light model on the backend.

mostly, independent channels and isps, is, our go to cable… operators.

all the tickets are responded through the same ticket in soho, right?
Which is what you were mentioning that it's very ticket centric.

So, everything's done from there, for example, if an escalation is needed or anything or they need me to step in or they need to send this to our sales department because the inquiry that they have is not technical support, then we can do internal comments within it or, you know, close a ticket or advise a client that we're going to contact them separately.
But most of the conversation, it's done through the ticket which goes to their email as well.
okay.

Yep.

I think one of the harder pieces is, you know, this is like technical troubleshooting with the client.

Those are some of the things I'm thinking about.
So, for example,
you know, our system, it does live within Gmail.
So I think Jeevan showed this where this is a Google Chrome extension.
And then everything that's coming to support or whatever domain would be populated here.
So we have our normal inbox, personal inbox, as well as the shared ticket inbox.
And then before I click into a ticket, we're going to have sentiment analysis of the customer tagging… so we can start like deciding… who which team should receive this ticket.
And then if.
we click into here this.
One's kind.
Of basic.
You know, they're having a tax question.
What I would do is a conversation has come in.
I would come, you know, assign it to myself to let people know that I'm working on it, you could reassign this to different members at a later time.

You know, very similar to zoho status of the ticket, open pending and closed… but where I think we could do some extra value is down here in our notes and activity section… you can add mention your colleagues.
And then this is going to post to slack.
So they're going to get a, you know, a link directly to the ticket where they can come in.
Now leave their activity feed in one spot.
And then additionally, we have custom fields.
So like, and this could be like a dropdown on like device number, free text.
So we have a lot of flexibility here in terms of gathering extra information about the ticket or device.
We also have a connected app to Jira.
I don't know if Jeevan showed this one… where we can create a Jira ticket directly from here.

This one's silly… because I wrote it in English.
But yeah, you can have a draft in different languages.
Usually our clients are all the support is done in English.

We're able to you?

So that creates a little bit of back and forth because I mean, my guys in Minsk, the first language would be Russian and then our clients would be in Spanish and we're communicated in English, right?
So it can work, it can work as well.
Yeah, yeah.
It's kind of a nice to have.
But the biggest piece in this draft reply is being able to refer to knowledge sources internally.
So what that looks like?
We're going to go into the admin panel of the shared inboxes.

So you could have multiple shared inboxes… whether it's like for various levels of technical support, one type one customer, like your most important customer could have their own inbox, things like that.
So there's four pieces of AI that I think are worth going through.
One is AI tagging.
So this is going to be configuring tags to be amended to conversations as they come in order to kind of route them to the right group of people.
So you'll come in here, create your tags and then you'll train the AI on 10 emails and then it'll automatically start applying.
So pretty straightforward.
How do we get conversations to the right people quickly?
Then we have the co pilot, which is what we call ask AI and ask AI allows you to use various knowledge sources.
So hiver has an internal knowledge base that you can create.
This is like the external facing version of it, but it's the same concept of just like a multi level knowledge base.
So.
Basically, for example, we have our knowledge base in zoho, we would have to completely move everything to hiver, correct?
Yes, if you were going to get rid of zoho.
But there's no way that it can connect to zoho and just check out what's there not.
Right now, you could like upload documents from zoho here.
So it's just like a simple upload like PDFS or, you know, word docs… and then you can also connect to notion.
We're going to be releasing a connection to Google drive shortly as well.
Okay.
Yeah.
So these are all the inputs of how to make the knowledge base smart enough to help answer some of the more technical questions.
So, you know, so… you know, we've routed it.
Now, we've helped reply to the conversation with the composer, the ask AI and the summarizer tools.
Now, after that, we have what we call AI quality assurance which allows you to kind of measure every team member on a six point scale and you can turn any of these off.
But the big ones that we're seeing demand for are clarity and completeness, you know, essentially ensuring that we have fully resolved the conversation.
And then we have reporting on a per person basis on all of this.
And if you would like, we could include this in the kind of the agent experience.
So they know how they're being ranked as well, just to, you… know, help them ensure that they're you know, responding in a complete and clear way.
Good.
Yeah, it can work for our internal metrics as well.
Precisely.
So that's kind of the AI functionality in terms of getting conversations to the right place, helping respond and measuring.
I also have another AI functionality which is what we call AI extract and I know we're over by one minute.
Do you guys have a couple more minutes or should we table this?
I don't have a problem.
Eugene, no, no problem.
Okay, great.
So AI extract, so we have this workflow engine that's like if this, then that logic based on various trigger events happening within the system.
So, for example, we're saying a new email comes in or out, and this is kind of silly.
But like the subject contains any of the following keywords?
What we could do is do an AI extract where we're extracting pieces of information from the body of the email and then amending it on the right hand side as a custom field.

So, what this should allow you to do if there are device numbers, plan numbers, like anything… that the client like needs to share in order for you to resolve a certain type of ticket… we could help categorize that in the right hand rail.
And… if, for some reason, you know, we don't have everything that we need, you know, we could like add a step like if, you… know, then.
If our AI variable does not contain the invoice number?
Then I could do an action step of sending an email back to the customer.
And then, yeah, and then this email will, you know, automatically send to the customer on the same thread.
So that way we're just like making sure that we're collecting everything that we need in one place.

We're just going to avoid a lot of the back and forth because for example, if Jenny, if they only send us a ticket that says, my Amazon app is not working, then we're going to need, you know, the device model, the version of the app they're using all of that.
Like if we get something that we can automate in this space, it's probably going to be easier for the guys to get the information faster, right?
Instead of level two, going to level three and saying, hey, they're saying that this is not working.
What do we need?
I'm telling you, okay, but we need, this and that this part can be automated.
Yeah.
Yeah, exactly.
And kind of the whole concept there.
Yeah.
Is now that we've collected the device number and everything else.

When we go back to the interaction, the AI assistant will be able to craft kind of more correct responses because we've uploaded, you know, the Amazon, you know, way of doing it and everything that we need.
So… okay.
Yeah.
